item.title: 美联储主席卡什卡利称利率可能会 "维持 "一段时间
item.description: 明尼阿波利斯联邦储备银行行长尼尔-卡什卡利（Neel Kashkari）重申，央行可能需要将利率维持在当前水平 "更长一段时间"，并质疑利率对美国经济的抑制作用有多大。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Minneapolis President Neel Kashkari repeated the central bank likely needs to keep interest rates at the current level for “a while longer,” and questioned how much they’re restraining the US economy.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚国内生产总值落后于预期，促使彼得罗呼吁加快宽松步伐
item.description: 哥伦比亚今年前三个月的经济表现落后于预期，这增加了央行加快降息步伐的可能性。【原文：Colombia’s economy lagged forecasts in the first three months of the year, boosting the chances that the central bank will accelerate the pace of interest rate cuts.】

item.title: 巴西国家石油公司下任首席执行官是一位倡导勘探的石油老将
item.description: 巴西国家石油公司（Petrobras）新任首席执行官是石油行业的资深人士，与巴西总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦（Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva）关系密切，曾推动过一些令股东担心超支的大型投资项目。【原文：The new chief executive officer of Petrobras is an oil-industry veteran with tight ties to Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva and a history of pushing for the types of massive investment projects that spook shareholders worried about overspending.】

item.title: 尽管股价下跌，GameStop 期权赌注仍在数日内寻求 300% 的涨幅
item.description: 即使 GameStop Corp. 的股价在周三暴跌，一些期权交易商仍在押注本周的大幅飙升。【原文：Even as GameStop Corp.’s shares cratered on Wednesday, some options traders were still betting on a massive leap this week.】

item.title: 伯南克称英国央行对利率预测的想法表现出兴趣
item.description: 本-伯南克（Ben Bernanke）说，英格兰银行内部对公布自己的利率预测越来越感兴趣，这是该央行正在酝酿重大沟通调整的最强烈信号之一。【原文：Ben Bernanke said there is growing interest within the Bank of England over publishing its own interest-rate projections, one of the strongest signals yet that the central bank is mulling a major communications shake-up.】

item.title: BMO 看好股市上涨势头，将 S&P 500 指数目标上调至 5,600 点
item.description: 随着 S&P 500 指数创下历史新高，蒙特利尔银行资本市场（BMO Capital Markets）预测，到 2024 年底，该指数还会有更大的涨幅。【原文：With the S&P 500 Index setting all-time highs, BMO Capital Markets is predicting even more gains through the end of 2024.】

item.title: 印度卫生部称干热天气导致首都空气质量恶化
item.description: 干燥的天气加上高温，使新德里及邻近地区的空气质量不断恶化，引发当局采取了一系列缓解措施。【原文：Dry conditions coupled with high temperatures are worsening air quality in New Delhi and adjoining areas, triggering a series of mitigation measures by authorities.】

item.title: 高盛自 3 月以来第三次开发高等级市场
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：A Goldman Sachs Group Inc. unit kicked off its second investment-grade bond sale of the past two months on Wednesday, after having previously gone five years without a deal.】

item.title: 泰森公司称采用部分鸡肉抗生素已见成效
item.description: 泰森食品公司（Tyson Foods Inc.【原文：Tyson Foods Inc. said its decision to resume the use of some antibiotics is paying off as birds are now healthier.】

item.title: 寒流加剧俄罗斯打击，乌克兰重新实行电力配给制
item.description: 由于气温骤降，遭受俄罗斯导弹袭击的电力系统承受了巨大压力，乌克兰重新对家庭和工业实行电力配给。【原文：Ukraine reimposed electricity rationing for households and industry as a dip in temperatures heaps pressure on a power system pounded by Russian missile strikes.】

item.title: 巴西央行行长为放缓降息的决定辩护
item.description: 巴西央行行长在一次公开演讲中证明了他改变该机构利率书面指导的决定是正确的，而在此前一天，另一名董事会成员表示，此举本应与整个董事会讨论，并通过更正式的渠道进行沟通。【原文：Brazil’s central bank chief justified his decision to change the institution’s written guidance on interest rates during a public speech, one day after another board member said such a move should have been discussed with the whole board and communicated through more formal channels.】

item.title: 雅德尼警告称，如果美联储 "失误 "降息，S&P 将熔化
item.description:
他说，如果7月或9月实施宽松政策，S&P指数将 "一举突破5400点"

。【原文：

The S&P would ‘blow right through 5,400’ with easing in July or September, he says

】

item.title: ESG基金清盘席卷美国ETF市场
item.description: 美国以环境、社会和公司治理为重点的交易所交易基金市场举步维艰。【原文：The US market for ESG-focused exchange-traded funds is floundering.】

item.title: 埃及从阿联酋获得 140 亿美元援助，里程碑式的交易得以兑现
item.description: 埃及从其与阿拉伯联合酋长国达成的具有里程碑意义的投资协议中又获得了 140 亿美元的资金，在货币浮动约两个月后，美元流动性再次激增。【原文：Egypt received a further $14 billion from its landmark investment deal with the United Arab Emirates, providing another surge of dollar liquidity about two months after a currency flotation.】

item.title: 特拉菲古拉称铝业涨势 "已结束"，供应回升
item.description: 据最大的金属贸易商之一 Trafigura 集团的分析师称，随着市场供应的恢复和高利率继续抑制制造业需求，铝价在未来六个月内至少会下跌 6%。【原文：Aluminum prices should decline by at least 6% over the next six months as supply returns to the market and high interest rates continue to crimp manufacturing demand, according to an analyst from Trafigura Group, one of the biggest traders of the metal.】

item.title: 德克萨斯资本聘请前瑞银银行家主管新的小额信贷业务
item.description: Texas Capital Bancshares Inc. 已聘请瑞银集团（UBS Group AG）的一名前高管负责市政债券业务。【原文：Texas Capital Bancshares Inc. has hired a former UBS Group AG executive to build out its municipal bond desk.】

item.title: CPI 显示通胀压力缓解，日元对美元汇率大涨
item.description: 在美国消费者物价增长读数显示通胀压力减弱后，日元兑美元汇率跳升超过 1%。【原文：The yen jumped more than 1% against the dollar after a reading of US consumer price growth showed softening inflation pressure.】

item.title: 德国商业银行称俄罗斯法律案件可能造成 "重大 "打击
item.description: 德国商业银行股份公司（Commerzbank AG）表示，它在俄罗斯面临着各种法律案件，这些案件造成了业务风险。【原文：Commerzbank AG said it’s facing various legal cases in Russia that have created a business risk.】

item.title: 交易员认为通胀缓解有助于美联储减息，国债飙升
item.description: 数据显示，衡量美国通胀的一项指标在 4 月份出现了六个月来的首次降温，之后国债反弹，使 10 年期国债收益率达到一个多月来的最低点。【原文：Treasuries rallied, sending 10-year yields to the lowest in more than a month, after data showed a gauge of US inflation cooled in April for the first time in six months.】

item.title: 淡水河谷印尼公司获得特别采矿许可证，有效期延长至 2035 年
item.description: 印尼淡水河谷公司（PT Vale Indonesia）获得了特别采矿许可证延期，结束了数月来对其未来运营的不确定性。【原文：Nickel miner PT Vale Indonesia received a special mining permit extension that ends months of uncertainty over its future operations.】

item.title: 美国核心 CPI 六个月来首次降温令美联储松了一口气
item.description: 衡量美国基本通胀率的指标在 4 月份出现了六个月来的首次降温，这表明物价压力正在逐步减弱，并支持了美联储在今年晚些时候降息的意图。【原文：A measure of underlying US inflation cooled in April for the first time in six months, indicating price pressures are abating gradually and supporting the Federal Reserve’s intent to cut interest rates later this year.】

item.title: 巴西国家石油公司首席执行官被解雇，巴西资产下跌，市场动荡不安
item.description: 国有巴西石油公司（Petroleo Brasileiro SA）高层突然被解职，引发了人们对政府干预该石油巨头的新担忧，巴西资产周三下滑。【原文：Brazilian assets slid Wednesday after the sudden dismissal of the top executive of state-owned Petroleo Brasileiro SA sparked fresh concerns over government interference at the oil giant.】

item.title: KKR 准备对价值 220 亿欧元的意大利电信交易采取欧盟补救措施
item.description: KKR & Co.准备提供一揽子承诺，以争取欧盟早日批准其以 220 亿欧元（238 亿美元）竞购意大利电信公司（Telecom Italia SpA）固话网络的计划。【原文：KKR & Co. is poised to offer a package of commitments aimed at winning an early European Union approval for its €22 billion ($23.8 billion) bid for Telecom Italia SpA’s land-line network.】

item.title: 沙特新矿业公司挑选业内资深人士担任首任首席执行官
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯马纳拉矿产投资公司（Manara Minerals Investment Co.）聘请资深交易员皮埃尔-切纳尔（Pierre Chenard）担任其首位永久首席执行官，这家矿业投资公司正在寻找更多资产。【原文：Saudi Arabia’s Manara Minerals Investment Co. hired veteran dealmaker Pierre Chenard to be its first permanent chief executive officer, as the mining investment firm searches for more assets.】

item.title: Direxion 开设人工智能股票杠杆反向 ETF
item.description: 看涨或看跌人工智能股票，并希望通过杠杆放大利润的专业投资者，现在可以通过两只新的交易所交易基金来实现这一目标。【原文：Professional investors with a bullish or bearish conviction on artificial-intelligence stocks and looking to magnify their profits with leverage can now do so with two new exchange-traded funds.】

item.title: 欧佩克+关于产量的决定可能将美元置于需求之上
item.description:

】

item.title: 美国进出口银行审计发现非洲缺乏增长战略
item.description: 根据监察长的一份审计报告，美国进出口银行缺乏明确的非洲发展战略，因为该银行旨在支持的贸易在过去十年中日渐式微。【原文：The US Export-Import Bank has lacked a clear strategy for growth in Africa as trade the lender is meant to support has waned over the last decade, according to an audit by the inspector general.】

item.title: 消息称摩根士丹利将从 Blackstone 风险投资公司购买房地产债务

item.title: 北欧电力联营交易后，冰岛将拥有首个电力市场
item.description: 冰岛即将建立第一个有组织的电力市场，此举将有助于提高电价的透明度。【原文：Iceland is about to get its first organized power market, a move that will help make rates more transparent.】

item.title: 地缘政治影响市场，桥水公司 40% 的赌注泡汤
item.description: Bridgewater Associates 首席执行官 Nir Bar Dea 警告投资者，在地缘政治紧张局势影响全球市场的情况下，不要对自己的仓位过于自信。【原文：Bridgewater Associates Chief Executive Officer Nir Bar Dea warned investors of becoming too overconfident in their positions as geopolitical tensions impact markets around the world.】
